unnormalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boom in Rajasthan!**
normalised: **Environmental News: Renewable Energy Boom in Rajasthan!**

unnormalised: Rajasthan, known for its vibrant culture and historical forts, is quickly becoming a hotspot for renewable energy. Dr. Sharma at the IIT-Jodhpur is leading groundbreaking research into solar panel efficiency, aiming to boost energy output from existing installations.
normalised: Rajasthan, known for its vibrant culture and historical forts, is quickly becoming a hotspot for renewable energy. Doctor Sharma at the I I T-Jodhpur is leading groundbreaking research into solar panel efficiency, aiming to boost energy output from existing installations.

unnormalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation Limited (RRECL) recently announced a new project near Jaisalmer, a massive solar park spanning over 5000 sq ft. This park alone is projected to power thousands of homes and businesses, reducing reliance on traditional coal-fired plants.
normalised: The Rajasthan Renewable Energy Corporation Limited (R R E C L) recently announced a new project near Jaisalmer, a massive solar park spanning over five thousand square feet. This park alone is projected to power thousands of homes and businesses, reducing reliance on traditional coal-fired plants.

unnormalised: Plus, several startups like "GreenSahara Innovations" are offering innovative financing options to farmers in arid regions to adopt solar-powered irrigation. They are now able to pump water for their crops, even in the scorching heat!
normalised: Plus, several startups like "GreenSahara Innovations" are offering innovative financing options to farmers in arid regions to adopt solar-powered irrigation. They are now able to pump water for their crops, even in the scorching heat!

unnormalised: The government plans to invest Rs. 20,000 crore in renewable energy projects over the next 5 years, targeting 5000 MW of renewable energy capacity by 2027. Experts believe that these initiatives are not just good for the environment but also for creating jobs and boosting the local economy. This makes them a win-win.
normalised: The government plans to invest rupee twenty thousand crore in renewable energy projects over the next five years, targeting five thousand megawatt of renewable energy capacity by two thousand and twenty seven. Experts believe that these initiatives are not just good for the environment but also for creating jobs and boosting the local economy. This makes them a win-win.
